title: Schema for Streamdeck Manifest file
description: This schema is based on the official documentation by Elgato available at https://developer.elgato.com/documentation/stream-deck/sdk/manifest/

Icon.description: The relative path to a PNG image (without .png extension)

Name.description: The display name of the Action that is displayed to the end user

PropertyInspectorPath.description: An alternative path to an entry point for the Property Inspector. If set, this will override the PropertyInspectorPath value of the plugin itself.

States.description: Defines the states the action can have

SupportedInMultiActions.description: Defines if the action can be used in multi-actions. Default value is true.

Tooltip.description: The tooltip that is displayed for the action in the actions list

UUID.description: The unique identifier of the plugin. It must be a "uniform type identifier" that contains only lowercase alphanumeric characters, hyphen and period. The string must be in reverse-DNS format.

VisibleInActionsList.description: Defines if the action is visible in the actions list. Default value is true.

Image.description: Contains the default image for this state

MultiActionImage.description: Alternate image for the action if it is part of a multi-action

Title.description: The default title of the state

ShowTitle.description: Determines if the title should be visible. Default value is true.

TitleColor.description: The default color of the title

TitleAlignment.description: The default vertical alignment of the title.

FontFamily.description: The default font family used for the title

FontStyle.description: The default style the title can be rendered in

FontSize.description: The default size of the title

FontUnderline.description: Determines if the title is underlined. Default value is false

DeviceType.description: Defines the type of the device

ReadOnly.description: Allows to flag the profile as read-only. Default value is false

DontAutoSwitchWhenInstalled.description: Prevents Stream Deck to automatically switch to this profile when it is installed. Default value is false

MinimumVersion.description: The minimum version of the specified platform that is supported. For Windows, you can use 10 to identify Windows 10.
The minimum version of Stream Deck that is supported by this plugin. The oldest version possible is 4.1.

mac.description: Mac application bundles the plugin should notified about.

windows.description: Windows applications the plugin should notified about.

Actions.description: Defines the actions of the plugin

Category.description: The name of the category under which the actions are listed

CategoryIcon.description: The relative path to the icon (in PNG format) but without the .png extension

CodePath.description: The relative path to the HTML/binary file that is the main entry point of this plugin

CodePathWin.description: A custom path that overrides the CodePath on Windows based machines

CodePathMac.description: A custom path that overrides the CodePath on macOS based machines

Description.description: A general description of the purpose of this plugin

Icon.description: The relative path to a PNG file (without .png extension) that is displayed in the store

Name.description: The displayed name of the plugin in the store

Profiles.description: An array of profiles that are proposed to the end user during installation

PropertyInspectorPath.description: The relative path to the HTML file of the Propery Inspector. If it is empty, the plugin will have an empty property inspector

DefaultWindowSize.description: Defines the default window size of a new window opened by the property inspector. Default value is [500, 650].

URL.description: A URL to a page with more details about the plugin

Version.description: The version of the plugin. The value can only contain digits and periods.

SDKVersion.description: The value of the used SDK. This value should be 2

OS.description: The operating systems and versions supported by this plugin

ApplicationsToMonitor.description: An array of all applications that should be monitored
